titleStmt.title: Simon Wiesenthal’s Map of the Jewish Mass-Graves and Concentration Camps-Cemeteries in Austria, 1948

publisher.ref: Vienna Wiesenthal Institute for Holocaust Studies

sourceDesc.bibl: Vienna Wiesenthal Institute for Holocaust Studies, Simon Wiesenthal Archives (on loan from BJVN), VWI-SWA,XI.3 Original in German, English, French and Russian.

msIdentifier.repository: Vienna Wiesenthal Institute for Holocaust Studies, Simon Wiesenthal Archives (on loan from BJVN)

note.p: Polish-Austrian Holocaust survivor, architect, writer. From the day of his liberation from the concentration camp Mauthausen onwards, he made it his life's task to find Nazi war criminals and collaborators and bring them to justice. His creed in this battle was ”Justice, not Revenge”, as one of his many books is called. He was also committed to combating post-war anti-Semitism, as well as commemorating the Holocaust and educating young people.

body.p: Karte der jüdischen Massengräber und KZ-Friedhöfe in Österreich
Map of the Jewish mass-graves and conc. camps -cemeteries in Austria
Carte de location des tombeaux juifs et des cimetières des camps de concentration en Autriche
Karta evreiskikh obshenikh mogil i kaldbischch konts-lagerei v Austrii
